page.title: 04LEWES RACECOURSE
page.content: Lewes racecourse was the first racecourse to be built in Sussex. It was first mentioned by Tom Marchent of Hurstpierpoint in his unpublished diary in 1714.In the early 1800's the Prince Regent stayed in Lewes for three days racing.Once Sir Fredrick Poole's horse, Waxy which had been the Derby winner that year won a one and a half mile sweepstake at Lewes.Princess Victoria once presented a silver bowl trophy at a race in Lewes. From the 1870's to the 1880's there were 2-3 meetings a year held at Lewes , and on the 6th of August 1880 Lewes racecourse got into the record books with a triple dead heat for first and a dead heat for second, this record still stands today. by Liam Allen, Oliver Taylor, and Jasper Sharpe.
